result.execSummary:
The defendant Erica M. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs are to be paid as follows:  $25 is due on or before 3-15-17 and then $25 is due by the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full.  A $15 payment plan fee has been added to the payment plan.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Must report on or before January 3, 2017 by 6:00 p.m..  Must report to Jackson County Jail kiosk daily for alcohol testing.  If found to be consuming alcohol prior to report date then stay is lifted and sentence is to begin immediately.
Must submit a DNA sample at the Jackson County Jail on December 22, 2016 and pay the surcharge.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears with counsel Stephanie Osborne.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  No victim rights notification issues in this case.  Court reviews charge and potential penalties and she pleads guilty to charge.  Court performs colloquy for elements/plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with defendant.  Court finds she understands the proceedings and plea is made freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intellignetly and enters her plea and she freely and voluntarily waives her rights.  Court finds a factual basis exists and finds her guilty.  State recommends 1 yr probation with conditions of risk and needs assessment with programming as recommended..... Court interrupts DA Fox as it's not what's indicated on the plea questionnaire.  Attorney Osborne explains her client does not want to do probation would rather do jail term.  State then recommends 60 days jail.  Attorney Osborne makes statement to the Court regarding her recommendation of 30 days with a report date after the holidays.  Defendant does not excercise her right to allocution.  Court orders a sentence of 60 days jail, stayed until 1-3-17 at 6:00 but must report for daily testing at Jackson County Jail kiosk and must not consume any alcohol before reporting.  If found to be consuming alcohol must begin to serve sentence immediately; must pay the costs at $25 per month commencing 3-15-17 with failure to pay of 1 day jail for every $25 left unpaid.  Must report for DNA sample submission on December 22 at Jackson County Jail; defendant given form in court.  Must meet with jail today to set up kiosk testing.
Erica called to get court date/time=gave her 12/19/16 @ 1:30 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
STC canceled & scheduled for PLEAS as requested by Atty Osborne; ok'd with DA's office.
Re-sent notice to defendant only at updated address received from SPDO

Pre-trial conference on October 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Stephanie Osborne.   Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant entered NGP.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 10/19 and STC 11/7 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
Initial appearance on September 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Recorded by FTR.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  She will go to SPD today.  AIA set for 9/26 at 9 am.  Bond continued.
